runs.comm: back of a length, shape away from the batsman, left alone to McCullum, who has put on the big gloves again

gone! New Zealand have made a good start to the defence. Tame dismissal, though, as he opens the face on this one outside off. There is slight holding of the line, and it's enough to take the outside edge
plays a length ball with an open face, towards point
good-looking square-drive, can't beat point, though
comes down the track, the ball stays low, he bunts it towards extra cover and nicks a single. Oram's overthrow allows them to come back for two
slower ball, beats his attempt at a square-drive, is called wide
comes down the track again, pushes a length ball into the on side for one
and it's the pace Sangakkara will like, especially if it is pitched on a driving length, and Sanga beautifully punches it back past him for four
shorter this time, hit to cover
chips down the track, cuts, Nathan McCullum misfields at point to let through a single
the first ball Dilshan faces he pulls in front of square. Again McKay's pace is ideal on this slow track, and Dilshan gets four
slower ball this time, and he is beaten on the pull
back of a length, no room, guided to point
beautiful square-drive again from Sanga, leaning into the shot, McCullum gets a hand on it, diving to his right at point
full ball, driven in front of square, straight to the fielder on the ring
short, slight width, and he runs it down with an open face, and because the third man is up in the circle, they get three runs
back of a length, no room, pushed to cover
angled into the pads, worked away to square leg for one
slower ball, looks to drop and run, but Dilshan sends him back
on the pads, pushed away for one
short and wide, hit in front of square, straight to cover
flat-bats this back, and hits Mckay in the shin area. No show of pain from McKay
charges at him, swings and misses one outside off
full ball outside off, pushed to cover-point
slower ball, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
Mills lends support to my plea. Slower ball, offcutter, Dilshan heaves way too early, and drags it onto the stumps. A battle of attrition, is this game
another slower ball, plays this in front of his body, towards mid-on
slower offcutter, gets an inside edge as he looks to push at it
another slower ball, Mathews is nearly squared up as he defends
short and quick, punched away to point
slower ball, into the pads, worked away for one
back of a length, defended off the back foot
wide down the leg side, McCullum makes a one-handed collection
sliding down the leg side again, Mathews misses out, gets a leg-bye
gets a bottom edge as he looks to drive this, having made room
driven on the up, on a half-volley to Redmond at extra cover
pushed to long-off for one
back of a length, angling in, gets an inside edge onto the pad
flighted around off, pushed towards midwicket
flighted around off again, hit back to the bowler
outside off again, worked into the on side for one
looks to work this into the on side, gets a semi leading-edge back to the bowler
back of a length, pushed into the off side for one
on the pads, worked around the corner
short ball, stops at him, and is hit to cover
better length, fuller, around off, hit to sweeper-cover for one
charges down and chips it towards long-on for one
runs this down to short third, wants one and is rightly sent back
quicker delivery, pushed down to long-off for one
goes deep into the crease to push this down the ground, but there is no timing and straight midwicket fields
finally he breaks free! Gives him the charge, makes room, and goes over midwicket. the cheerleaders there come and dance on the playing field. That's American sport
wide down the leg side
and another biggie! Gives him the charge again and goes over midwicket again, only more elevation, and gets a rare six. And although we are in his country, these are no Mickey Mouse boundaries
on the pads, worked away for one
angled into the pads, worked around the corner for one
short delivery, stays low, and he pulls it wide of long-on for two
onto the pads again, helped away to short fine leg
dabbed to cover, can't get through for one
similar shot, but there is an early call this time, and they come through for one
long hop, pulled away nicely... and gone! He has picked out deep square leg. Not much more to said about this wicket
short ball again, punched to sweeper-cover
comes forward and defends
short ball, turning away, pushed wide of point for one
length ball, into the pads, pushed away for one
back of a length, pushed to cover
quicker ball, down the leg side, brushes his pad and goes for a leg-bye
short delivery, but no room, and hence hit down the ground for one
back of a length, pushed to long-on for one
surprisingly no slower ones so far from Styris, and he concedes another single to long-off
quicker one, stays low too, and Kapugedera defends
remarkably slower, this one, defended off the front foot
goes back and cuts this in front of square for one
flighted around middle and leg, helped around the corner for one
length ball, pushed to long-off for one
flighted delivery, there is some turn on this one, presses forward and defends it
offcutter finally, but into the pads, and worked away fine of fine leg for two
back of a length, seam up, hit to long-on for one
slower offcutter, and Styris strikes! Mathews looks to launch it out of the ground, and is early into the shot and holes out to long-on, where Oram is filling in for Guptill
Styris's lethal slower balls into the act. It's a rank long hop, but is made even slower by the pitch, and what's more it stays low too. Kapugedera pulls and holes out to deep square leg
Styris deserts his trusted slower one, bowls seam up, and Jayasinghe defends it well
angled into the pads, gets a leg-bye

hint of some shape away, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and through to short third. Perera wants a suicidal single and is sent back, and a big dive and a not-so-clean collection and whipping of bails from Redmond help him survive
into the pads, gets a single to midwicket
pushed to extra cover for one, Redmond slides and throws to create a chance, misses the stumps, but the backing-up is good
short, angling in, no space there, Jayasinghe gets an inside edge past McCullum for one
punched on the up, but straight to mid-off
slower ball, short and wide, and cut away in front of square for one
nearly another for the lethal lethal slower delivery. Gets a thick edge on this big shot, and it just about clears short third man
seam up, around off, hit back to the bowler
offcutter, offcutter, and Jayasinghe slogs and misses
another slower ball, beats the batsman again, concedes just a leg-bye

and Styris consumes another! Perera goes for the big hit down the ground, no pace to work with again, and the toe end of the bat carries as far as long-off. Styris, my friend, is unplayable in limited-overs cricket on such pitches
long hop, pulled, one bounce to deep midwicket
fired into the pads, gets a dot ball
short, turning away, pushed to extra cover
shooter, almost bounces twice before reaching McCullum, who does well to keep this one
flighted around off, pushed back to the bowler
quicker, flat, gets a bottom edge as he looks to run this to third man, but he is safe
flat delivery again, no room again, hit back to the bowler
short ball, and he throws his bat at it, and the thick edge flies fine of short third man. Rare, rare boundary
slower ball, hit off the inside half of the bat towards square leg
slower ball again, and hit down to long-on for one
short and quick outside off, and beats him on the cut

slower ball, played to point on the bounce, and McCullum's superb work manufactures a run-out here. The throw is not quite on the stumps, McCullum collects it wide, and then tumbles over as he flicks the bails off, thus earning half a second
yorker outside off, hit back to the bowler
makes room and chips it over extra cover for two
tries to play the scoop shot over short fine, gets a thick leading edge over short third. McKay's pace might not be the best way to go for New Zealand
edged and taken! Randiv charges at him, makes room, looks to go over mid-off, and gets a toe end and McCullum catches it to his right
short, into the ribs, can't do much with that
short ball again, Malinga is back away as he hits it back to the bowler
and everything is going NZ's way. Half-volley, hit back powerfully, and it hits Southee's shin and deflects onto the stumps, and Malinga is backing up, and has to go
short ball, pulled away to square leg for one
short outside off, played to short third man
slower ball, hit to extra cover
worked into the on side for one
half-volley, chipped down to long-on for one
short, makes room and cuts it away for one
all over. Oh it's not, it's a no-ball. Mendis backs away and upper-cuts it straight to third man, and Gould calls it a no-ball
bowled him, but it's a free hit
slower ball, beats him, concedes a bye as it bounces in front of McCullum
all over now. Full and straight, Mendis swings, misses, and McKay uproots the off stump
